text:
We use the following construct to copy some
files during deployment to an ejb-server.

<copy todir="${wlcs.home}/server/public_html" preservelastmodified="true">
    	<fileset dir="${webapp.basedir}" 
includes="${webapp.type}/${webapp.domain}/cgi/**" />
	<mapper 	type="regexp" 
				
from="^${webapp.type}/${webapp.domain}/cgi/(.*)$$" 
				to="cgi-bin/\1"
	/>
</copy>

This works fine on our unix machines but does not
work when we're running the build from a windows 
machine.
The problem is caused from the mapper element, which 
takes '/' or '\' in from and to literally instead of 
converting to the actual file separator. (unlike it 
is done for include, exclude and related attributes).

So, as a workaround, we have to replace every '/' with 
either ${file.seperator} or with . or with [/\\] or 
something similar. 

Although this works fine it, the problem should be 
mentioned in the documentation (if the current
implementation represents the desired behaviour).

Greetings 
Matthias

This is explained in the documentation for mappers in Ant 1.4 (and later).
Please see the paragraph immediately following the table of attributes for the
mapper element.
